page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: {THE SURROUNDING AREA IS FLAT , {GOOD QUALITY, AGRICULTURAL LAND {WITH A NOTICEABLE LACK OF TREES. {THE LAND IS EXSTENSIVELY USED {FOR CEREAL PRODUCTION,CABBAGE/ {BRUSSELSPROUTS AND GENERAL MARKET {GARDENING.THE PRINCIPAL VILLAGE {WITHIN THE AREA IS LANGFORD WHICH {IS LONG AND STRAGGLING EXTENDING {ALONG THE BIGGLESWADE TO HENLOW {ROAD.IT IS BOUNDED ON ONE SIDE BY {THE LONDON TO EDINBURGH RAILWAY {AND ON THE OTHER THE MEANDERING {RIVER IVEL.THERE HAS BEEN BUILDING {RECENTLY AND THE HOUSING IS A MIXTURE {OF COUNCIL AND OWNER OCCUPIED.THE {LOWER SCHOOL STANDS OPPOSITE THE {14CENTURY CHURCH DEDICATED TO ST. {ANDREW.THE OTHER TWO SMALLER VILLAGES {NAMELY STANFORD AND BROOM ARE WITHOUT {CHURCH OR SCHOOL. {
